meanings.definition: Not in accordance with fact or reality.
meanings.sent1: The story he told was the untruest tale I had ever heard.
meanings.sent2: She knew the statement was untruest, but she didn't want to hurt his feelings.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the dog's meow was the untruest thing she had ever heard.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as untruest as a mirage in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting looked so untruest under the dim light.

meanings.sent1: It was the untruest weather forecast we had ever received.
meanings.sent2: The witness's testimony was proven to be untruest during the trial.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so untruest that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as untruest as a painted one on a clown's face.
meanings.sent5: The map's directions were so untruest that we ended up lost in the forest.
